channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Biden to sell child care and free university in speech to Congress
item.description: The Democrat will pledge to enact free pre-school and community college in a speech to Congress.

item.title: Arlene Foster announces resignation as DUP leader and NI first minister
item.description: Mrs Foster says she is stepping down as leader on 28 May and as NI first minister at the end of June.

item.title: Electoral Commission to investigate Boris Johnson's Downing Street flat renovations
item.description: The Electoral Commission says there are "reasonable grounds to suspect an offence" may have occurred.

item.title: Covid: UK orders 60m extra Pfizer doses for booster jabs
item.description: It is expected that the most vulnerable groups will be offered another jab before next winter.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani: US investigators raid former Trump lawyer's home
item.description: The former New York mayor and lawyer to Donald Trump is being investigated for dealings with Ukraine.

item.title: Paris St-Germain 1-2 Man City: Kevin de Bruyne & Riyad Mahrez give City advantage in Champions League
item.description: Manchester City score twice in seven minutes to win at Paris St-Germain in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final.

item.title: Apollo 11 astronaut Michael Collins dies at 90
item.description: Michael Collins stayed in orbit as Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walked on the Moon in 1969.

item.title: Apple profits double as it squares up to Facebook
item.description: Tech rivals both enjoy bumper profits but Apple's latest move could dent Facebook's future sales.

item.title: Parminder Nagra: TV show turned me down for being of Indian descent
item.description: Bend it Like Beckham and ER actress Parminder Nagra says she was rejected by "a well-known TV show".

item.title: Julia James: Death of PCSO found in Snowdown woods treated as murder
item.description: Colleagues believe the death of serving community support officer Julia James is suspicious.

item.title: Liverpool hosts 'pioneering' mask-free business conference
item.description: Liverpool hosts the UK's first "normal" business conference, with no obligatory social distancing.

item.title: The Papers: 'Boris painted into corner' and how to get 'fancy wallpaper'
item.description: The papers report the Electoral Commission's probe into funding the refurbishment of the PM's flat.

item.title: Kate and William's 10 years of marriage in pictures
item.description: The past decade has seen the duke and duchess travel the world, work with charities and raise a family.

item.title: Back to the office? Science reveals best desks to nab
item.description: Where you sit in an open-plan office can determine how content and productive you feel, researchers find.

item.title: Family-meal image wins international food photo contest
item.description: A photo of a family preparing a meal in China wins Pink Lady Food Photographer of the Year 2021.

item.title: Car parking: Shopper spends six years using each spot at supermarket
item.description: Gareth Wild logged each space at a local supermarket to "find fun in the mundane".

item.title: PMQs: Five Boris Johnson claims fact-checked
item.description: Investigating claims about flat renovations, vaccines and misleading statements.

item.title: Children of the 90s study: 'I feel privileged to be part of it'
item.description: In 1991, Bristol University began tracking 14,000 pregnant women - and it's still studying their children.

item.title: Birds of Oz: The charming natives that found TikTok fame
item.description: A colourful set of Australian birds has attracted a surprise global following on social media.

item.title: EastEnders actress Lacey Turner calls for better miscarriage support
item.description: Lacey Turner has has two miscarriages and believes the current system needs reforming.

item.title: Why a US photographer says 'sorry for the war'
item.description: Peter van Agtmael chronicles the perception of the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq and their realities.

item.title: Lotus to launch last pure petrol sports car
item.description: The Emira will be the carmaker's last conventionally powered model, as it prepares for an all-electric future.

item.title: Pink Supermoon seen around the world
item.description: Stargazers were treated to the fourth full Moon of 2021 on Monday night.

item.title: Arlene Foster: From trailblazing leader to party civil war
item.description: BBC News NI looks back at the career of first minister of Northern Ireland, Arlene Foster.

item.title: Covid-19: UK Indians rally to help during Covid crisis
item.description: British Indians are fundraising for oxygen equipment as family abroad face record Covid infections.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Why crying can help you succeed in business
item.description: Tina Chen explains how it can be tough starting a business on your own in a new country.

item.title: Downing Street flat: What are the rules about political donations?
item.description: Boris Johnson is under mounting pressure over the funding of his Downing Street flat renovations.

item.title: Hartlepool by-election: Old certainties no longer apply
item.description: The traditional political rule about governments losing by-elections do not seem to count for much now.

item.title: Saving cash: A customer said we'd changed her life
item.description: Eight locations across the UK are testing ideas aimed at ensuring future access to cash for those who need it.

item.title: Emilia Clarke on the book that helped her to grieve for her dad
item.description: Jenny Diski's writing was "tonic for the soul" for the Game of Thrones star after her father died.

item.title: Dog theft: Simple tips to stop your puppy being pinched
item.description: With dog thefts on the rise, here are some tips on how you can keep your dog as safe as possible.

item.title: Kenyans bitter over al-Qaeda US embassy compensation snub
item.description: Kenyan victims of 1998 US embassy bombing lament exclusion from $335m compensation deal.

item.title: Kuwait: Murder spurs demands for greater safety for women
item.description: The killing by the woman's alleged harasser fuels outrage over women's safety in the Gulf state.

item.title: Mon Laferte: The Chilean pop sensation challenging repression
item.description: Musician Mon Laferte is releasing her first album since speaking out about the country's protests.

item.title: India Covid: The messages deciding between life and death
item.description: Avani Singh was one of thousands of Indians who turned to social media to get help for her family.

item.title: Murphy holds off Trump to join Wilson, Selby & Bingham in semi-finals
item.description: Shaun Murphy withstands a Judd Trump fightback to complete the semi-final line-up at the World Championship in Sheffield.

item.title: 'It's for gymnasts who don't feel safe' - Voss on full-body suits
item.description: Gymnast Sarah Voss says she wants to be a "role model for young gymnasts who don't feel very safe" after competing in a full-body suit.

item.title: Marcelo doubt for Real against Chelsea after polling duty call in Madrid
item.description: Real Madrid's Marcelo may miss their Champions League semi-final second leg at Chelsea because of polling station during local elections.

item.title: Wales back North out of Lions tour with knee injury
item.description: Wales back George North is ruled out of the British and Irish Lions tour of South Africa because of a serious knee injury.

item.title: Arsenal beat struggling West Ham to boost Champions League hopes
item.description: Arsenal move three points clear of Manchester United in the race for a Champions League place with a 2-0 victory over struggling West Ham.

item.title: Women's Super League highlights: Vivianne Miedema & Kim Little score as Arsenal beat West Ham
item.description: Watch highlights as Arsenal beat West Ham 2-0 in the Women Super League thanks to goals from Vivianne Miedema and Kim Little.

item.title: President Biden's first 100 days as president fact-checked
item.description: Joe Biden has been US president for 100 days - we look at claims he has made during his first months.

item.title: Biden 100 days: Is US more or less unified under President Biden?
item.description: Americans weigh in on the president's first 100 days in office.

item.title: Biden speech: Are Americans happy with Biden's first 100 days?
item.description: Members of our Ask America panel praise Biden's Covid response but call for more bipartisanship.

item.title: Tim Scott: Republican senator giving rebuttal speech to Biden
item.description: Tim Scott, who will deliver the rebuttal to the president, is the only black Republican Senator.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants are reopening in Wales and Scotland - as part of significant easing of lockdown rules.

item.title: Foreign holiday guide: The red list, green list and quarantine rules
item.description: An NHS app is being adapted to be used as a Covid passport for people holidaying abroad - Transport Secretary, Grant Shapps, has confirmed.

item.title: Covid: Can you catch the virus outside?
item.description: The risks of catching Covid indoors are well-known, but what are the chances of being infected outdoors?

item.title: What are the Indian, Brazil, South Africa and UK variants?
item.description: Cases are being found in the UK and the changes the virus is undergoing are concerning.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - but big celebrations with lots of guests are some way off.

item.title: Why India's Covid crisis matters to the whole world
item.description: The situation in India is a bleak reminder that none of us will be safe until everyone is safe.
